title: 10+ Best Graphics Cards for AutoCAD in 2025 (April Update)
description: AutoCAD software requires a graphics card to deliver 3D graphics quickly on screen. Let us discuss some of the best AutoCAD graphics card available.
author: Jacob Cass
byline: Meet our expert writers and contributors
excerpt: AutoCAD software requires a graphics card to deliver 3D graphics quickly on screen. Let us discuss some of the best AutoCAD graphics card available.
text: Every computer needs a dedicated graphics card to meet its requirements. Without the graphics card, your gaming PC would not be able to give the display output and you would not be able to see anything on your display screen. Graphics Cards (GPU) deliver images to the monitor by converting data in the form of signals so that your monitor recognizes them. AutoCAD software requires a graphics card to deliver 3D graphics quickly on the screen. Let us discuss some of the best AutoCAD graphics cards available based on overall performance alone, value, and specifications. Our Top Pick Best Value Best Budget PNY NVIDIA Quadro P2000 AMD Radeon PRO W5700 PNY GeForce GTX 1660 Super 6 GB Primary Rating: 4.7 Primary Rating: 4.7 Primary Rating: 4.7 $230.00 $229.00 $259.00 Description: The PNY NVIDIA Quadro P2000 graphics card is our top pick that has 5GB GDDR5 memory and 1024 CUDA cores to quickly process AutoCAD with multi-monitor support up to 5120x2880 resolution. Description: If you are looking for a value graphics card, then AMD Radeon Pro W5700 is an excellent choice. It comes with 8GB GDDR6 memory, 5 display outputs, 448GB/s bandwidth, and 205W power consumption for fast rendering. Description: The PNY GeForce GTX 1660 Super 6GB graphics card is a great option for your tight budget. It utilizes fast GDDR6 memory and an NVIDIA architecture to provide high-performance frame rates for smooth AutoCAD performance. Buy on Amazon Buy on Amazon Buy on Amazon Our Top Pick Description: The PNY NVIDIA Quadro P2000 graphics card is our top pick that has 5GB GDDR5 memory and 1024 CUDA cores to quickly process AutoCAD with multi-monitor support up to 5120x2880 resolution. Best Value Description: If you are looking for a value graphics card, then AMD Radeon Pro W5700 is an excellent choice. It comes with 8GB GDDR6 memory, 5 display outputs, 448GB/s bandwidth, and 205W power consumption for fast rendering. It utilizes fast GDDR6 memory and an NVIDIA architecture to provide high-performance frame rates for smooth AutoCAD performance. 04/29/2025 04:01 pm GMT 11 Best Graphic Cards for AutoCAD in 2025 PNY NVIDIA Quadro P2000 — Best overall Graphics Card for Balanced Performance (Editor’s Choice) AMD Radeon PRO W5700 — Best Graphics Card for Professional PC Workstation Asus GeForce Turbo GTX 1080 — Best Graphics Card for Power Gaming PNY GeForce GTX 1660 Super 6 GB — Best Affordable Single Fan Graphic Card GeForce GTX 1050 Ti by Gigabyte — Best Graphical Card for Desktop PCs AMD Radeon Pro WX 7100 — Best Budget Graphics Card for Virtual Reality NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3090 — Ferocious GPU for Ray Tracing ASUS ROG Strix GeForce RTX 2080 Ti — Best Advanced Gaming Graphics Card AMD Radeon VII 16 GB — Best Graphics Card for Content Creation VisionTek Radeon 7750 — Best High-Resolution 4K display MSI GeForce RTX 4060 Ti — Best for professional CAD workstations Also, see our feature on the best laptops for AutoCAD. What Is the Best Graphics Card for AutoCAD? PNY NVIDIA Quadro P2000 is the best graphics card for AutoCAD available. However, check for the full list below: Best Performer Best PC card Best Power Gaming Best Dual-Screen Best Large Display Best Touchscreen PNY NVIDIA Quadro P2000 Graphic Card - 5 GB GDDR5 - Full-Height AMD Radeon Pro W5700 Graphic Card - 8 GB GDDR6 - Full-Height ASUS GeForce GTX 1080 8GB Turbo Graphic Card TURBO-GTX1080-8G Gigabyte - Graphics card Gigabyte VGA NVIDIA GTX 1050 OC 4 GB DDR5 AMD Radeon Pro WX 7100 100-505826 8GB 256-bit GDDR5 Video Cards - Workstation ASUS GeForce RTX 2080 TI ROG Strix 11GB GDDR6 Graphics Card Outputs 3x DisplayPort and 1x USB Type-C 1 x DVI-D 2 x HDMI 2.0 2 x DisplayPort 1.4 Dual-link DVI-D *1 HDMI-2.0b*1 Display Port-1.4 *1 Best Performer PNY NVIDIA Quadro P2000 Graphic Card - 5 GB GDDR5 - Full-Height Outputs 3x DisplayPort and 1x USB Type-C Best PC card AMD Radeon Pro W5700 Graphic Card - 8 GB GDDR6 - Full-Height Best Power Gaming ASUS GeForce GTX 1080 8GB Turbo Graphic Card TURBO-GTX1080-8G Outputs 1 x DVI-D 2 x HDMI 2.0 2 x DisplayPort 1.4 Best Dual-Screen Gigabyte - Graphics card Gigabyte VGA NVIDIA GTX 1050 OC 4 GB DDR5 Outputs Dual-link DVI-D *1 HDMI-2.0b*1 Display Port-1.4 *1 Best Large Display AMD Radeon Pro WX 7100 100-505826 8GB 256-bit GDDR5 Video Cards - Workstation Best Touchscreen ASUS GeForce RTX 2080 TI ROG Strix 11GB GDDR6 Graphics Card 10+ Best AutoCAD Graphics Cards in 2025 1. PNY NVIDIA Quadro P2000 (Editor’s Choice) PNY NVIDIA Quadro P2000. Image Credits: Amazon Best overall AutoCAD graphics card for balanced performance Specifications Boost Clock 1545 MHz | Memory 5GB GDDR 5 | Memory Speed 6008 MHz | Outputs 3x DisplayPort and 1x USB Type-C | TDP 160 W | Suggested PSU 450 W PNY NVIDIA Quadro P2000 consists of the VCQ P2000 PB series, which is manufactured by the NVIDIA company. This graphics card comes with 5 GB of GDDR5 memory, which is enough to work with AutoCAD. The bandwidth is also around 140GB per second, which helps you deliver the pictures quickly. One aspect that impressed us is that the 1024 CUDA core increases the input and output of the data processing without problems. It can support more than four display monitors with a resolution of 5120 x 2880 and a memory speed of 66 MHz. It consumes only a maximum of 75 watts on the power supply, so you don’t need to worry about building a PC with a supercooling system. This is one of the best graphics cards for your CAD work because of its all-around great performance too. One notable drawback of this graphic card is that its cooling fans and intricate hardware components can generate what many might consider a lot of noise. Pros Cons ➕ Good bandwidth. ➖ Quite loud. ➕ Less power consumption ➕ Image rendering in a short period of time. Latest Price on Amazon: Best overall AutoCAD graphics card 2. AMD Radeon Pro W5700 AMD Radeon Pro W5700. Image Credits: Amazon Best graphics card for professional PC workstation Specifications Boost Clock 1545 Mhz | Memory 8 GB 256 bit GDDR6 | Memory Speed 448 Gbps | Outputs 5x Mini-DisplayPort 1.4 | TDP 205 W | Suggested PSU 400 W One of the best graphic cards for AutoCAD is the AMD Radeon Pro W5700. It has a RAM size of 8GB GDDR6, which means that you need not worry about one of the primary things that bothers us the most gamers, the storage space for your work. However, one of the things we particularly love about this is that it supports five different 1.4 display Miniports and one type C port with power connectors of 1×6 pin and 1×8 pin. With a good bandwidth of nearly 448GB per second, you can draw amazing images in the least amount of time possible. You also have cooling fans so that you don’t need to worry about damaging your only one graphics card. It consumes 205 watts of power, which is not a lot to worry about. One downside of this graphic card is its tendency to exhibit elevated fan noise levels when subjected to extensive multitasking or resource-intensive applications. Pros  Cons ➕ Impressive RAM size. ➖ There are no built-in accelerators to compete with NVIDIA’s tensor and RT core ➕ Supports cooling system. ➖ Video encoding performance is not up to the mark. ➕ DirectX Support. Latest Price on Amazon: Best for professional PC workstation 3. Asus GeForce Turbo GTX 1080 Asus GeForce Turbo GTX 1080. Image Credits: Amazon Best graphics card for power gaming and CAD Specifications Boost Clock 1733 MHz | Memory 8GB 256-Bit GDDR5X | Memory Speed 10Gbps | Outputs 1 x DVI-D 2 x HDMI 2.0 2 x DisplayPort 1.4 | TDP 180W | Suggested PSU 500 W We consider the Asus Graphic Card one of the best graphics cards for AutoCAD users. The NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1080 graphics coprocessor was primarily developed for gaming but is now extensively used for AutoCAD programs. It has an 8GB memory that works well with its 320.3 G per second bandwidth, which really helps with input and output transfer, thus leading to smooth processing. It can support two display ports of 1.4, two HDMI ports, and 1 DVI connector. It also has effective cooling fans that decrease friction and use dual ball-bearing structures to increase their effect, which really lengthens the graphic card’s life as well. One of the notable disadvantages of this graphic card is the lack of dedicated built-in accelerators akin to NVIDIA’s Tensor and RT cores. This absence additional features may impact the card’s ability to keep up with evolving software trends and emerging standards, potentially diminishing its competitiveness this market segment in rapidly advancing field of graphics technology. Pros Cons ➕ Less Expensive. ➖ The sound of the fan increases when running a lot of applications. ➕ Supports AutoCAD without issues. Latest Price on Amazon: Best for power gaming and CAD 4. PNY GeForce GTX 1660 Super 6 GB PNY GeForce GTX 1660 Super 6 GB. Image Source: Amazon Affordable single-fan graphics card Specifications Boost Clock 1530 MHz | Memory 6 GB GDDR6 | Memory Speed 14 Gbps | Outputs 1.57” × 6.61” × 4.96”; Dual-Slot | TDP 125 W | Suggested PSU 450 W PNY GeForce GTX 1660 Super 6 GB graphics card is faster than the original GTX 1660 and also one and a half times faster than its previous generation version. It is powered by the NVIDIA architecture and ultra-fast GDDR6 memory. The GDDR6 memory helps it run much faster and performs better than the original GTX 16 series. When used with a monitor that has some hardware installed in it, the monitor’s high refresh rate will sync and lock with the graphics card’s output frame rate. It removes the tearing and stuttering that can result from the conventional, fixed screen refresh rates. It is a product of the PNY brand coupled with the super series NVIDIA GeForce GTX1660 which makes it a faster and more efficient graphics card while providing greater quality at an affordable rate. The bandwidth makes the best video developing quality and the resolution makes it suitable for the fine work of AutoCAD designing and graphics. It has a single-fan cooling system that will help with power consumption efficiency. Pros Cons ➕ Cheap for the features. ➖ Only one HDMI and display port are available. ➕ 4K Resolution. ➖ No other extra features ➕ No sound was found. Latest Price on Amazon: Affordable single-fan graphics card 5. GeForce GTX 1050 Ti by Gigabyte GeForce GTX 1050 Ti by Gigabyte. Image Credits: Amazon Best graphics card for Desktop PCs Specifications Boost Clock 1506 MHz | Memory 4GB GDDR5 VRam | Memory Speed 7 Gbps | Outputs Dual-link DVI-D *1 HDMI-2.0b*1 Display Port-1.4*1 | TDP 75 W | Suggested PSU 350 W This graphics card has 4 GB of onboard memory, one dual-link DVI port, one display connector, and a six-pin power supply connector. Two fans in it can be used for cooling purposes and run in opposite directions for better airflow. This card comes with Gigabyte’s gaming software that lets you overclock and monitor the card, as well as adjust the fans and manage the LED lighting at the same time. It also supports G-sync anti-tearing technology. It is covered with a three-year warranty. This card features the NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1050 Ti processor. This processor is the most important part of any graphics card. Pros Cons ➕ Less Expensive. ➖ Slower Clock speed. ➕ Huge Memory. ➕ Exceptional Performance. Latest Price on Amazon: Best for Desktop PCs 6. AMD Radeon Pro WX 7100 AMD Radeon Pro WX 7100. Image Credits: Amazon Best graphics card for virtual reality Specifications Boost Clock 1243 MHz |  Memory 8 GB GDDR5 | Memory Speed 7000 MHz | Outputs 4x DisplayPort 1.4 | TDP 130 W | Suggested PSU 300 W The AMD Radeon Pro WX 7100 runs with the minimum clock speed. It features acceleration options and can run up to 1243 MHz. The manufacturer has equipped this particular graphics card with 8 GB of memory and excellent bandwidth. At 130 watts, the power consumption is also much lower than other graphics cards. Radeon Pro WX has evolved from AMD FirePro. It has all the benefits of the evolution of the FirePro driver and includes optimization for a massive range of CAD tools. There are minor differences between the two. AMD always points to the superior build quality of this GPU, which includes the more robust heat sinks for a better connection to the PCI slot. Pros  Cons ➕ Better performance. ➖ Not suitable for gaming purposes. ➕ Good design. Latest Price on Amazon: Best for virtual reality 7. NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3090 NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3090. Image Credits: Amazon Ferocious GPU for ray tracing Specifications Boost Clock 1.70 GHz | Memory 24 GB GDDR6 | Memory Speed 19.5 GBPs | Outputs 1x HDMI 3x DisplayPort | TDP 350 W | Suggested PSU 750 W The NVidia GeForce RTX 3090 rules the technical world, although AMD is trying to topple it. This particular graphics card has GDDR6X RAM, which acts as an absolute powerbox to it. It delivers improved performance when it comes to 3D rendering.  This card has replaced two previous generations with its new features and high performance. The NVidia GeForce RTX 3090 has impressive performance but gives an amazing 4K performance and even handles games. The previous graphics card had set a high standard and this one also meets the challenge. It handles PC games very well, but it delivers very attractive images with graphical enhancements of 3D animation and video rendering. The NVidia GeForce RTX 3090 also comes at a premium price, making the more affordable graphics card, the RTX 3080, its direct competitor with rival competitive pricing. If you are a developer, not bothered by the price and want the best performance for your project-related work, that requires very good hardware acceleration. Pros Cons ➕ Gaming performance. ➖ Expensive. ➕ Quiet operation. ➖ Triple-slot card. ➕ Excellent cooling. Latest Price on Amazon: Ferocious GPU for ray tracing 8. ASUS ROG Strix GeForce RTX 2080 Ti  ASUS ROG Strix GeForce RTX 2080 Ti. Image Source: Amazon Best advanced gaming graphics card Specifications Boost Clock 1665 MHz | Memory 11 GB GDDR 6 | Memory Speed 14000 MHz | Outputs HDMI DP 1.4 USB Type-C  | TDP 250 W | Suggested PSU 600 W The ASUS ROG Strix GeForce RTX 2080 Ti comes with 4532 CUDA cores that deliver unmatched images. The main selling point for this graphics card is real-time and ray tracing performance. The difference is the accuracy and the efficiency with which this card executes the technology. It doubles the graphics processing power. The memory bandwidth stands at 616Gbps, enabling it to fast transfer the data from the RAM to the GPU. The available space is 11 GB of GDDR6 VRAM. The boost clock speed can be enhanced with a self-implemented overclock. The most interesting point is that, even with such processing power, the power consumption is not as high. Pros Cons ➕ High bandwidth. ➖ Premium price. ➕ Runs quietly. ➕ Offers 11GB of VRAM. Latest Price on Amazon: Best advanced gaming graphics card 9. AMD Radeon VII 16 GB AMD Radeon VII 16 GB. Image Source: Amazon Best graphics card for content creation Specifications Boost Clock 1750 MHz | Memory 16GB HBM 2 | Memory Speed 4 Gbps | Outputs Display port x 3(v1.4)/HDMI 2.0 B X 1 | TDP 250 W | Suggested PSU 650 W The AMD Radeon VII is the graphics card that the entire world has been waiting for. It is a high-end graphics card for gamers that almost equalizes the NVidia GeForce RTX 2000 card, and beats them in a few areas as well. It is one of the best graphics cards available for creative people. It has a high-end 16 GB of video memory (VRAM) and a high-boost clock of 1800 MHz. It is an extremely powerful graphics card with a great price and an initial problem of DirectX12 incompatibility. Pros Cons ➕ Attractive and compact. ➖ Very loud. ➕ Good computing performance. Latest Price on Amazon: Best graphics card for content creation 10. VisionTek Radeon 7750 VisionTek Radeon. Image Credit/ Amazon Best high-resolution 4K display The VisionTek Radeon 7750  is known for its high-resolution 4K display. The card can be used on Windows 10, 8, 8.1, 7, Vista, and XP. Each DisplayPort transmits superb 7.1 surround-sound audio to each monitor independently. It also comes with a native display port that will allow you to connect to any monitor with one display cable. Also, each display port comes with independent audio, which provides independent sound to each monitor. It is almost unavoidable to notice how well the product’s features shine. Pros Cons ➕ Easy to Install ➖Not suitable for hardware gaming. ➕Smooth Running Latest Price on Amazon: Best high-resolution 4K display 11. MSI GeForce RTX 4060 Ti Ventus 2X Black 8G OC MSI GeForce RTX 4060 Ti Ventus 2X Black 8G OC. Image Credit: Amazon Best graphics card for professional CAD workstations Specifications- Boost Clock: 2580 MHz | Memory: 8 GB GDDR6 | Memory Speed: 18 Gbps | Outputs: 3x DisplayPort 1.4, 1x HDMI 2.1a | Power Consumption: 160W | Cooling Design: Dual fan with Torx Fan 4.0, Copper baseplate, Core pipe heat sink, Zero Frozr technology The MSI GeForce RTX 4060 Ti Ventus 2X Black 8G OC is a top-tier option for AutoCAD users looking for performance and efficiency. Equipped with 8GB of GDDR6 memory and a boost clock of 2580 MHz, this card delivers excellent speed and memory bandwidth for smooth handling of 3D models and complex AutoCAD designs. The 18 Gbps memory speed ensures rapid data processing, which is essential when working on intricate drawings or large files. Its cooling system features MSI’s advanced Torx Fan 4.0, dual fan setup, and a copper baseplate to maintain optimal temperatures during long rendering sessions. The card also supports DLSS 3, Ray Tracing, and NVIDIA Reflex, making it a versatile choice for both 3D rendering and more demanding design applications. With a power consumption of 160W, it’s energy efficient for high-performance tasks. While the card shines in high-end performance, one downside could be the higher price compared to non-GPU-accelerated cards. Nonetheless, the MSI RTX 4060 Ti excels in offering superb 3D rendering and precise performance, ideal for users who demand high graphical fidelity in AutoCAD. PROS CONS ➕ Excellent memory and clock speeds for AutoCAD tasks ➖ Higher price point compared to entry-level models ➕ Advanced cooling design for optimal performance ➖ May not be necessary for simple 2D CAD tasks ➕ Full support for DLSS 3 and Ray Tracing Latest Price on Amazon: Best for professional CAD workstations Types of Graphics Cards There are two types of graphics cards Integrated Graphics Dedicated Graphics Most computers come with an integrated graphics card embedded within them as it renders the images to the monitor. Integrated Graphics These graphics cards are built directly onto the motherboard or the processor of your computer or laptop. They are cost-effective because they come with computers, but they cannot be upgraded. It is small in size, power-efficient, and less costly than the dedicated graphics card. Intel and AMD come in the same price for a CPU with integrated Graphics. If you are using a laptop for day-to-day tasks, such as watching YouTube or browsing the internet, this is more than enough. These graphics cards use the resources of the memory subsystem computer to process the graphics requirements. Dedicated Graphics A dedicated graphics card is a hardware part that is responsible for the graphics performance of the computer and is called a “discrete card”. There are many different types of graphics cards. NVidia and AMD are pioneers when it comes to graphics cards. The advantage of a graphics card is that you can always find one to is powerful enough for the task. The dedicated graphics card requires an expansion slot on the motherboard. You need to make sure you have the supported expansion slot in your motherboard before you buy a graphics card. You can also read our blog on the best graphics cards for video editing. How to Choose the Right Graphics Card for AutoCAD?  Resolution Higher resolution refers to the pixels per inch. Having a graphic card for AutoCAD will give you high-quality images. To have a 4k resolution, you must look for a graphic card with high memory. You can also pick a computer with memory higher than 8 GB. Performance  Performance is another important factor to look for when buying a graphic card. If you have a graphics card with fast performance, it will have a good impact on your high-resolution gaming. Along with these, the performance also depends on the hardware generations. Within every two years, Nvidia and AMD bring a new series. This new series will include more advanced features like memory, bandwidth, and more cores. Since the rendering power depends upon the number of cores, these factors can give great results. Output Considering output and display will help you to choose the right AutoCAD graphics card. Most modern graphics cards include either HDMI or Display ports. If you are focusing on 4k and 5k displays, then it has connectivity for DisplayPort 1.4 and HDMI 2.0 standards. Frequently Asked Questions What is the role of a graphic card on a computer? A graphic card is also called a video card or a graphics adapter. It is an expansion card that determines the kind of graphic output that is displayed on the monitor. What is the necessity for a graphic card? Some gaming and graphics programs can be tough on computers and create a greater chance of thermal trauma. In these cases, Graphics cards come in handy. An extensive graphics card is required to help the computer smoothly perform heavy tasks. It also reduces the load on the computer. What is the difference between single, double, and triple fan graphics cards? The difference is in the cooling ability that these cards provide. A triple fan graphics card is a well-suited option for cooling the card and helps to increase the work performance. Double fans also do the same operation but with less performance and more efficiency than a single fan. Is a dedicated graphics card required for AutoCAD? No, AutoCAD does not require a dedicated graphics card to run. AutoCAD is a CPU-intensive program, not a GPU-intensive program. It requires a VRam for about 128MB, which comes standard on practically all computers. However, depending on your requirements it is recommended to use good and high-speed RAM Best Graphics Cards for AutoCAD We prepared this list of the best graphics cards available on the market for your review. Each one of these graphics cards has the potential to perform well in rendering images and graphics on your display screen. Now it depends on you to select the best card and right graphics card for you based on your requirements and budget for your AutoCAD projects playing games and other work. Every computer needs a dedicated graphics card to meet its requirements. Without the graphics card, your gaming PC would not be able to give the display output and you would not be able to see anything on your display screen.

Graphics Cards (GPU) deliver images to the monitor by converting data in the form of signals so that your monitor recognizes them.

AutoCAD software requires a graphics card to deliver 3D graphics quickly on the screen.

Let us discuss some of the best AutoCAD graphics cards available based on overall performance alone, value, and specifications.

10+ Best AutoCAD Graphics Cards in 2025

1. PNY NVIDIA Quadro P2000 (Editor’s Choice)

Best overall AutoCAD graphics card for balanced performance

Specifications Boost Clock 1545 MHz | Memory 5GB GDDR 5 | Memory Speed 6008 MHz | Outputs 3x DisplayPort and 1x USB Type-C | TDP 160 W | Suggested PSU 450 W

PNY NVIDIA Quadro P2000 consists of the VCQ P2000 PB series, which is manufactured by the NVIDIA company.

This graphics card comes with 5 GB of GDDR5 memory, which is enough to work with AutoCAD. The bandwidth is also around 140GB per second, which helps you deliver the pictures quickly.

One aspect that impressed us is that the 1024 CUDA core increases the input and output of the data processing without problems. It can support more than four display monitors with a resolution of 5120 x 2880 and a memory speed of 66 MHz.

It consumes only a maximum of 75 watts on the power supply, so you don’t need to worry about building a PC with a supercooling system. This is one of the best graphics cards for your CAD work because of its all-around great performance too.

One notable drawback of this graphic card is that its cooling fans and intricate hardware components can generate what many might consider a lot of noise.

Pros

 Cons
➕ Good bandwidth. ➖ Quite loud.
➕ Less power consumption
➕ Image rendering in a short period of time.

2. AMD Radeon Pro W5700

Best graphics card for professional PC workstation

Specifications Boost Clock 1545 Mhz | Memory 8 GB 256 bit GDDR6 | Memory Speed 448 Gbps | Outputs 5x Mini-DisplayPort 1.4 | TDP 205 W | Suggested PSU 400 W

One of the best graphic cards for AutoCAD is the AMD Radeon Pro W5700. It has a RAM size of 8GB GDDR6, which means that you need not worry about one of the primary things that bothers us the most gamers, the storage space for your work.

However, one of the things we particularly love about this is that it supports five different 1.4 display Miniports and one type C port with power connectors of 1×6 pin and 1×8 pin.

With a good bandwidth of nearly 448GB per second, you can draw amazing images in the least amount of time possible. You also have cooling fans so that you don’t need to worry about damaging your only one graphics card. It consumes 205 watts of power, which is not a lot to worry about.

One downside of this graphic card is its tendency to exhibit elevated fan noise levels when subjected to extensive multitasking or resource-intensive applications.

Pros 

Cons
➕ Impressive RAM size. ➖ There are no built-in accelerators to compete with NVIDIA’s tensor and RT core
➕ Supports cooling system. ➖ Video encoding performance is not up to the mark.

3. Asus GeForce Turbo GTX 1080

Best graphics card for power gaming and CAD

Specifications Boost Clock 1733 MHz | Memory 8GB 256-Bit GDDR5X | Memory Speed 10Gbps | Outputs 1 x DVI-D 2 x HDMI 2.0 2 x DisplayPort 1.4 | TDP 180W | Suggested PSU 500 W

We consider the Asus Graphic Card one of the best graphics cards for AutoCAD users. The NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1080 graphics coprocessor was primarily developed for gaming but is now extensively used for AutoCAD programs.

Types of Graphics Cards

There are two types of graphics cards

  • Integrated Graphics
  • Dedicated Graphics

Most computers come with an integrated graphics card embedded within them as it renders the images to the monitor.

Integrated Graphics

These graphics cards are built directly onto the motherboard or the processor of your computer or laptop. They are cost-effective because they come with computers, but they cannot be upgraded.

It is small in size, power-efficient, and less costly than the dedicated graphics card.

Intel and AMD come in the same price for a CPU with integrated Graphics. If you are using a laptop for day-to-day tasks, such as watching YouTube or browsing the internet, this is more than enough.

These graphics cards use the resources of the memory subsystem computer to process the graphics requirements.

Dedicated Graphics

A dedicated graphics card is a hardware part that is responsible for the graphics performance of the computer and is called a “discrete card”.

There are many different types of graphics cards. NVidia and AMD are pioneers when it comes to graphics cards. The advantage of a graphics card is that you can always find one to is powerful enough for the task.

The dedicated graphics card requires an expansion slot on the motherboard. You need to make sure you have the supported expansion slot in your motherboard before you buy a graphics card.

You can also read our blog on the best graphics cards for video editing.

How to Choose the Right Graphics Card for AutoCAD? 

Resolution

Higher resolution refers to the pixels per inch. Having a graphic card for AutoCAD will give you high-quality images. To have a 4k resolution, you must look for a graphic card with high memory. You can also pick a computer with memory higher than 8 GB.

Performance 

Performance is another important factor to look for when buying a graphic card. If you have a graphics card with fast performance, it will have a good impact on your high-resolution gaming. Along with these, the performance also depends on the hardware generations.

Within every two years, Nvidia and AMD bring a new series. This new series will include more advanced features like memory, bandwidth, and more cores. Since the rendering power depends upon the number of cores, these factors can give great results.

Output

Considering output and display will help you to choose the right AutoCAD graphics card. Most modern graphics cards include either HDMI or Display ports. If you are focusing on 4k and 5k displays, then it has connectivity for DisplayPort 1.4 and HDMI 2.0 standards.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is the role of a graphic card on a computer?

A graphic card is also called a video card or a graphics adapter. It is an expansion card that determines the kind of graphic output that is displayed on the monitor.

What is the necessity for a graphic card?

Some gaming and graphics programs can be tough on computers and create a greater chance of thermal trauma. In these cases, Graphics cards come in handy. An extensive graphics card is required to help the computer smoothly perform heavy tasks. It also reduces the load on the computer.

What is the difference between single, double, and triple fan graphics cards?

The difference is in the cooling ability that these cards provide. A triple fan graphics card is a well-suited option for cooling the card and helps to increase the work performance. Double fans also do the same operation but with less performance and more efficiency than a single fan.

Is a dedicated graphics card required for AutoCAD?

No, AutoCAD does not require a dedicated graphics card to run. AutoCAD is a CPU-intensive program, not a GPU-intensive program. It requires a VRam for about 128MB, which comes standard on practically all computers. However, depending on your requirements it is recommended to use good and high-speed RAM
